clinical_study.brief_title: RL-1 Novel Human-derived Bio-artificial Liver Treatment in Patients of HBV Related ACLF
clinical_study.official_title: Therapeutic Effects and Safety of RL-1 Novel Human-derived Bio-artificial Liver Treatment in Patients of Hepatitis b Virus Related Acute-on-chronic Liver Failure

lead_sponsor.agency: Third Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

clinical_study.source: Third Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to investigate the clinical efficacy and safety of RL-1 Novel Human-derived Bio-artificial Liver treatment in patients with Hepatitis b virus related acute-on-chronic liver failure.

detailed_description.textblock: Hepatitis b virus (HBV) related acute-on-chronic liver failure (ACLF) is a serious condition with high mortality rate in China. But there still lacks of effective therapies in treatment of HBV related ACLF, except liver transplantation. RL-1 Novel Human-derived Bio-artificial Liver treatment may be an effective and safe therapy due to the previous clinical data. This study is to investigate the clinical efficacy and safety of RL-1 Novel Human-derived Bio-artificial Liver treatment in patients with HBV related ACLF.

primary_outcome.description: All adverse events (i.e. fever, allergy, bleeding, hypotension, thrombosis) are observed in the follow-up.

secondary_outcome.description: Whether patients will survive after treatment is observed in the follow-up.
All symptoms (i.e. fatigue, appetite, nausea, vomiting, jaundice, consciousness) are observed in the follow-up.
Blood cells are observed in the follow-up.
Alanine transaminase is observed in the follow-up.
Total bilirubin is observed in the follow-up.
Prothrombin time is observed in the follow-up.
Blood ammonia is observed in the follow-up.

arm_group.description: 10 patients will receive conventional treatment plus plasma exchange

arm_group.arm_group_label: RL-1 Novel Human-derived Bio-artificial Liver treatment group
arm_group.description: 10 patients will receive conventional treatment plus RL-1 Novel Human-derived Bio-artificial Liver treatment

intervention.description: Patients will receive treatment of plasma exchange for three times in two weeks. The volume of fresh frozen plasma used in plasma exchange is about 2000 millilitre per time.

intervention.intervention_name: RL-1 Novel Human-derived Bio-artificial Liver Treatment
intervention.description: Patients will receive RL-1 Novel Human-derived Bio-artificial Liver treatment for three times in two weeks. The volume of plasma exchanged in the system is about 4000 millilitre per time.
